io.netty.channel

Interface ChannelHandlerUtil.SingleInboundMessageHandler<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Base64Decoder, ByteArrayDecoder, ChannelInboundMessageHandlerAdapter, HttpContentDecoder, HttpContentDecompressor, HttpObjectAggregator, MessageToMessageDecoder, ProtobufDecoder, SctpInboundByteStreamHandler, SctpMessageCompletionHandler, SctpMessageToMessageDecoder, SpdyHttpDecoder, StringDecoder, WebSocketClientProtocolHandler, WebSocketFrameAggregator, WebSocketServerProtocolHandler
    Enclosing class:
    ChannelHandlerUtil

    public static interface ChannelHandlerUtil.SingleInboundMessageHandler<T>

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean acceptInboundMessage(Object msg)
      Returns true if and only if the specified message can be handled by this handler.
      boolean beginMessageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Will get notified once ChannelStateHandler.inboundBufferUpdated(ChannelHandlerContext) was called.
      void endMessageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Is called when messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext, Object) returns.
      void messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, T msg)
      Is called once a message was received.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptInboundMessage

        boolean acceptInboundMessage(Object msg)
                             throws Exception
        Returns true if and only if the specified message can be handled by this handler.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message
        Throws:
        Exception

      • beginMessageReceived

        boolean beginMessageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                             throws Exception
        Will get notified once ChannelStateHandler.inboundBufferUpdated(ChannelHandlerContext) was called. If this method returns false no further processing of the MessageBuf will be done until the next call of ChannelStateHandler.inboundBufferUpdated(ChannelHandlerContext). This will return true by default, and may get overriden by sub-classes for special handling.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext which this ChannelHandler belongs to
        Throws:
        Exception

      • messageReceived

        void messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
                   T msg)
                     throws Exception
        Is called once a message was received.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext which this ChannelHandler belongs to
        msg - the message to handle
        Throws:
        Exception

      • endMessageReceived

        void endMessageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                        throws Exception
        Is called when messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext, Object) returns. Super-classes may-override this for special handling.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ChannelHandlerContext which this ChannelHandler belongs to
        Throws:
        Exception
